outfit_formulas.formula_name: Flared jeans + simple camisole + cardigan + flat sandals
Pencil skirt + knit sweater + blazer + heels
Knee-length skirt + knit sweater + coat + heels
Straight-leg pants + oversize shirt + jacket + flats
Mini dress + oversize button-down (tie at waist) + sneakers

selection_rules: Main colors should reflect the essence of your style and be ones you feel super comfortable wearing a lot.
Accent colors should work well with each neutral and at least two of your main colors.
Neutral colors should support and balance out the other colors.
Choose neutrals after selecting main and accent colors to ensure they complement the overall palette.
For maximum mixability, each new piece should work with at least several colors in your palette.
mixing_rules: Pair statement pieces in accent colors with neutral basics to avoid overpowering a look.
Use neutral pieces to tone down bold colors or fill in gaps in an outfit.
Accent colors should be used for statement pieces and accessories that pair with main colors and neutrals.
texture_and_print_rules: Pay attention to materials, fabrics, and textures (e.g., cotton, leather, knitting, chiffon) as essential components of style.
If you love a pattern but not for clothing, consider incorporating it into home decor or artwork.

garment_fit_checklist: Does it hang on your body as the designer intended?
Does it feel comfortable and allow you to move freely?
Does it stay put without having to be readjusted?
Is it free of bulging, puckering, billowing, or wrinkling?
Does it follow the natural curves of your body?
Can you see yourself wearing this for many seasons?
garment_quality_checklist: Is the fabric soft, strong, and dense (for cotton)?
Is the fabric free of pills?
Is the fabric tightly woven and not see-through?
Are seams straight, neat, and secure?
Do patterns line up at the seams?
Are load-bearing seams double-stitched, French seamed, or bound?
Does the garment have darts on the front and under the bust for shaping?
Is there a center back seam (for jackets and coats)?
Does the garment have a shoulder yoke (for shirts and blouses)?
Does the garment include interfacings and facings?
Is the lining made of a sturdy, antistatic material with the same care code as the outer fabric?
Are buttonholes reinforced and of the keyhole type (for jackets and cardigans)?
Are buttons spaced evenly and secured with multiple threads?
Does the zipper move smoothly and lie flat without puckering?
Are pockets reinforced and of adequate length?
Are labels woven and placed comfortably?
Am I prepared to properly take care of this item (according to care label)?
purchase_decision_checklist: Does this piece reflect my personal style?
Do I like how it looks on my body?
Can I think of a clear role for this item within my wardrobe?
Does it work with my lifestyle?
Is it mixable with at least three other outfits?
Does it fit well and is it comfortable?
Is the garment well-constructed and made from a high-quality material?
Will this piece fill a gap in my wardrobe?
Is buying this piece the best use of my budget right now?
Do I want to buy this for reasons other than need and style (e.g., sale, boredom, stress)?
Can I think of at least three concrete outfits I could create with this piece?
Can I see myself wearing this for many seasons?
